noun.description: An astrological and meteorological calendar, written on a stone tablet with movable pegs used to insert the days of the month at the side of the text.

origin: Mid 17th century (in an earlier sense). From classical Latin parapēgma astronomical and meteorological calendar, and its etymon Hellenistic Greek παράπηγμα astronomical and meteorological calendar, rule, precept from ancient Greek παρα- + πῆγμα framework fastened or joined together.
